titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I am better, but still a wreck. After breakfast in bed, I read my letters & the papers, then I got up & went to my study. Beyond writing a number of letters I found myself unequal to work. Ella showed Harold over both the Cathedral and the Castle.
I received a long pencilled letter form Ernest Rudling telling me that he had at last gained his "wings", & was about to fly to France for active service.

The latest accounts from the front indicate that the Germans are making a great effort to recover their superiority in the air. We admit to having lost 23 machines in the recent fighting: the Germans assert that the losses of the Allies amount to no less than 56 machines.

"The Church, like the ark of Noah, is worth saving not for the sake of the unclean beasts & vermin that almost filled it – and probably made most noise & clamour in it – but for the little corner of rationality, that was much distressed by the stink within it as by the tempest without" – Warburton.
century version of the doctrine of the saving remnant!
